Using grep to show lines adjacent to the search string

Jan 13, 2018 â€¢ {"login"=>"bobmclarke915800472", "email"=>"bob.mclarke@gmail.com", "display_name"=>"Bob Clarke", "first_name"=>"", "last_name"=>""}

Using a file with the following contents:

line 1
line 2
line 3
line 4
line 5
line 6
line 7
line 8
line 9
line 10

cat test_data | grep -B2 'line 5'

will display:
line 3
line 4
line 5

cat test_data | grep -A2 'line 5'

will display:
line 5
line 6
line 7

cat test_data | grep -A2 -B2 'line 5'

will display:
line 3
line 4
line 5
line 6
line 7
